extracted_text:
IPAC Criteria List

In the submission box one team member has to submit which 4 of these criteria your team wants to use. That team member need to submit a list of 4 with just the word in bold, for example Communication, Respect, Listening, Contribution

Participation – Taking part in all team activities including meetings and group communications. Participation is at the right time and appropriate for the activity and for what is being discussed.

Reflection – Thinking about your contribution to the team and the team project and sharing insights in to what has been successful, what has not and how the project or teamwork could be improved.

Communication – Imparting, exchanging and listening to information, ideas or updates from other team members and responding in a clear and timely manner.

Contribution – Bringing your ideas or thoughts to the team. Completing assigned tasks for the team and supporting the work of others. Working on the outputs that need to be delivered by the team.

Respect – having awareness of other people feelings, wishes or needs, valuing them and acting appropriately to accommodate them were possible. 

Reliability – Being dependable. Delivering on promised actions or agreements and letting the team know of any changes or problems as soon as they crop.  Being ready to help in a crisis.

Initiative – Assessing a situation and taking action if necessary. Starting a course of action or process before issues become critical, while keeping team members informed.

Organisation – managing time and workloads to ensure that you complete tasks and attend meetings/workshops within the timeframe set. Aiding with team organisation and scheduling of tasks.

Listening – taking the time to listen carefully, to notice what others say, to acknowledge what they say, or check your understanding with them and respond in an appropriate way.

Co-operation – working together to achieve the same end. Interacting with other team members constructively in a way which allows you all to benefit.
